notes_text: On 30 March 2021, Prime Minister Robert Abela announced a proposal to legalize possession of up to and the cultivation of up to 4 plants, and for people charged with possession in the past to have it expunged from their criminal records. In December 2021, legislation was passed by the Maltese Parliament and signed into law by President George Vella.
